definitions: not capable of being understood due to unclear articulation or expression
examples: His speech became unintelligible after the accident
The old recording was unintelligible through the static

definitions: happening or resulting without deliberate planning or conscious purpose
examples: The medication had unintended side effects
His unintended comment sparked a major controversy

definitions: happening or performed without conscious purpose or deliberate planning
examples: The damage was completely unintentional on her part
He made an unintentional mistake in his calculations

definitions: showing no curiosity, attention, or emotional involvement in something
examples: She seemed uninterested in the conversation
The students were uninterested in ancient history

definitions: failing to capture attention or stimulate curiosity; boring or dull
examples: The lecture was thoroughly uninteresting to most attendees
She found the book uninteresting and stopped reading

definitions: proceeding without breaks, pauses, or interference from external factors
examples: They enjoyed three hours of uninterrupted sleep
The view offered uninterrupted vistas of mountains

definitions: arriving or participating without having received an invitation or permission
examples: Several uninvited guests appeared at the party
His uninvited advice annoyed everyone present

definitions: having no participation, connection, or emotional investment in something
examples: She remained uninvolved in office politics
The uninvolved bystanders watched from a distance

definitions: connected with or characteristic of organized workers' associations
examples: The union workers went on strike yesterday
She attended the union meeting last night

definitions: having workers who belong to or are represented by labor unions
examples: The unionized workforce negotiated better benefits
Most unionized industries have standard wage scales

definitions: being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else
particularly remarkable, special, or unusual in character
examples: Each snowflake has a unique crystalline structure
The museum houses unique artifacts from ancient civilizations
She has a unique talent for languages
The restaurant offers a unique dining experience

definitions: designed to be suitable or used by people of any gender
examples: The store sells unisex clothing and accessories
They installed unisex bathrooms in the building

definitions: consisting of or characterized by being a single, unified whole
examples: The country adopted a unitary system of government
They proposed a unitary theory of consciousness

definitions: combined or joined to form a single entity or group
showing complete agreement and working together harmoniously
examples: The united forces launched a coordinated attack
The United States celebrated its independence day
The team presented a united front against criticism
The community was united in its support

definitions: relating to or affecting all people, things, or situations without exception
examples: Access to education should be a universal right
Love is a universal human emotion

definitions: failing to conform to principles of justice, fairness, or moral rightness
examples: The court overturned the unjust conviction
Workers protested against unjust labor practices

definitions: impossible to defend, excuse, or show to be right or reasonable
examples: The committee found the expenses unjustifiable
Such violence is morally unjustifiable

definitions: not based on good reasons or legitimate grounds; without justification
examples: Her fears proved to be completely unjustified
The criticism seemed harsh and unjustified

definitions: having a messy, disheveled, or neglected appearance, especially of hair or clothing
examples: His unkempt beard made him look older
The garden had an unkempt, overgrown appearance

definitions: showing a lack of sympathy, consideration, or gentle behavior toward others
examples: It was unkind to mention her recent failures
His unkind remarks hurt her feelings deeply

definitions: not able to be known or understood by human intelligence or experience
examples: The ultimate nature of reality remains unknowable
Some aspects of the universe are unknowable

definitions: lacking knowledge or awareness of something; done without conscious realization
examples: She was an unknowing participant in the scheme
His unknowing smile revealed his innocence

definitions: not within the range of one's knowledge, experience, or understanding
not recognized or famous; obscure in reputation or achievement
examples: The cause of the disease remains unknown
They ventured into unknown territory
She was an unknown actress before this role
The painting is by an unknown artist

definitions: not conforming to or permitted by law; illegal or illicit
examples: The court ruled the search was unlawful
They were charged with unlawful assembly

definitions: containing no lead or lead compounds, especially describing gasoline
examples: Most cars now require unleaded gasoline
The station only sells unleaded fuel

definitions: operating or existing without official permission or required legal documentation
examples: The unlicensed driver was arrested immediately
They shut down the unlicensed restaurant

definitions: having different qualities or characteristics from something else specified
examples: Her style is unlike anything I've seen
This year was unlike any previous year

definitions: having a low probability of happening, being true, or being the case
examples: Rain seems unlikely given the clear skies
It's unlikely that she'll arrive on time

definitions: not restricted in quantity, extent, or scope; boundless or infinite
examples: The plan offers unlimited data and calls
She seemed to have unlimited energy

definitions: not included in a list, directory, or official record
examples: Her phone number is unlisted for privacy
The unlisted securities trade over the counter

definitions: having no cargo, passengers, or ammunition; empty of contents
examples: The unloaded truck weighed much less
Always treat a gun as if it's loaded, even when unloaded

definitions: not fastened or secured with a lock; open to access
examples: The door was left unlocked all night
She found his phone unlocked on the table

definitions: experiencing or marked by bad fortune or unfavorable chance
examples: He was unlucky to miss the opportunity
Friday the 13th is considered an unlucky day

definitions: not put in order or arranged properly, especially referring to beds
examples: She left the bed unmade in her rush
The unmade beds gave the room a messy look

definitions: impossible or very difficult to control, organize, or deal with effectively
examples: Her hair becomes unmanageable in humid weather
The debt had grown to unmanageable proportions

definitions: not having or needing a human operator or crew present
examples: The unmanned spacecraft traveled to Mars
They deployed unmanned aerial vehicles for surveillance

definitions: having no marks, signs, or distinguishing features for identification
examples: Police officers drove unmarked cars for surveillance
The grave remained unmarked for decades

definitions: not joined in marriage; single or without a spouse
examples: She remained unmarried throughout her life
The survey included both married and unmarried couples

definitions: having no equal in quality, extent, or degree; incomparable
examples: Her skill in negotiation is unmatched
The view offers unmatched beauty

definitions: so clear or obvious that it cannot be mistaken or misunderstood
examples: There was unmistakable joy in her voice
The unmistakable scent of roses filled the room

definitions: not lessened or moderated in any way; absolute and unqualified
examples: The project was an unmitigated disaster
She spoke with unmitigated frankness

definitions: remaining in original form without alterations or modifications
examples: The car remains unmodified from factory specifications
They used unmodified genetic material

definitions: not affected by emotion or persuasion; remaining indifferent
not changed in physical position or location
examples: She remained unmoved by his desperate pleas
The judge seemed unmoved by the testimony
The furniture stayed unmoved for decades
The boulder remained unmoved despite their efforts

definitions: not identified by name; anonymous or not given a name
examples: An unnamed source leaked the information
The unnamed island appeared on old maps

definitions: contrary to the ordinary course of nature; abnormal
lacking in ease or spontaneity; contrived or forced
examples: The unnatural color suggested artificial dyes
Scientists studied the unnatural phenomenon
Her smile seemed forced and unnatural
He spoke in an unnatural voice

definitions: not needed or required; serving no useful purpose or function
examples: The extra packaging seemed unnecessary
Avoid unnecessary delays in the process

definitions: not required or wanted; superfluous or redundant
examples: They removed all unneeded items from storage
His unneeded advice irritated everyone

definitions: deprived of courage, confidence, or composure; made anxious or unsettled
examples: She felt unnerved by the strange noises
The team was unnerved by early setbacks

definitions: causing one to lose courage or confidence; unsettling or disturbing
examples: The silence was unnerving after the explosion
She had an unnerving habit of staring

definitions: not seen, detected, or observed by anyone; escaping attention
examples: The error went unnoticed for several months
She slipped away unnoticed during the party
